name: in-VR Settings Unable to connect
message:
Hello!

Hi 

 I'm sorry you're experiencing hiccups with our new experimental in-VR app.

 Let's tackle this step by step.
 - First, uninstall the app from your unknown sources and restart the headset. 
 - Reinstall the app using our Web Installer again. 
 - Now, once the app is open in the headset, change just one setting by clicking the hamburger menu to the left and going back to the settings page, the refresh rate from 72 to 90, for example, and it should take effect

 Now you can carry on using the app as normal and change settings. Be sure the Wireless icon in the top right doesn't have a line through it.

 Thanks for giving it a try; stay tuned for many more improvements! 

 If you have further issues, please don't hesitate to make a new post. Godspeed!

name: Connection Problems USB
message:
Hello!

It seems you're encountering some USB connection challenges. Let's tackle this step by step. First, I suggest experimenting with different USB cables if you have any spare ones. Alternatively, borrowing a cable can be a quick test method without purchasing a new one immediately. It's often surprising how frequently issues are due to a simple cable fault.

Also, try connecting to different USB ports on your device. Sometimes, certain ports don't work as well as others for various technical reasons. An additional tip: with USB Type-C connectors, flipping the connector 180 degrees can sometimes make a difference, so it's worth a try.

If you manage to establish a connection, even briefly, switching to 'Enable wireless mode' in the SideQuest app can be a great workaround. This wireless mode can save you from future USB hassles and streamline your VR experience.

For a more permanent solution; once you have a stable connection, consider using the easy installer to install SideQuest directly on your headset. This method can significantly simplify future interactions with SideQuest.

Remember; these technical hiccups are just small bumps on the exciting road of VR exploration. Keep a positive attitude, and you'll overcome this in no time. We're here to support you every step of the way, so please don't hesitate to reach out if you have more questions or need further assistance.

Wishing you the best of luck and lots of fun in your VR adventures!

name: Unknown Sources v55
message:
Hey there!

On the home screen inside your headset, look for a button on the right with a 3x3 square grid. This is the 'App Library' button. Click it, then click on the search bar. A filter icon should show up next to the search box. Click this icon, and at the bottom of the drop-down list that appears, pick 'Unknown Sources'.

This will let you see all the games you've installed from SideQuest. You can then pick a game and start playing!

I hope this helps! Safe travels on your journey.

name: Not SideQuest Support
message:
Hello!

You can often find links to their social media and Discord channels on the game's SideQuest page, usually on the right-hand side.

In case you're wrestling with a complex technical issue, remember that it's always okay to seek assistance from friends or family members who might be more familiar with these kinds of challenges. However, please remember that our community here is primarily equipped to support SideQuest-specific queries. While our ability to assist with issues outside of that scope might be limited, we still hope you find the guidance you need.

Best of luck on your SideQuest journey, and if there's anything SideQuest-related we can help you with, don't hesitate to reach out!

Safe travels!

name: Mobile app
message:
I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble connecting your phone to the SideQuest app.

We recommend you use our new experimental Web-Installer using any Chrome browser instead from https://sdq.st/download 

If you would like to get the mobile app working, let's try troubleshooting steps to remove the 'Important' toaster message.

- Check Compatibility: Ensure your phone is compatible with the SideQuest app. Not all phones support ADB over OTG, which is necessary for connecting to SideQuest.

- Developer Mode: Make sure that Developer Mode is activated on your phone. This is essential for the SideQuest app to function correctly.

- USB Debugging: On your phone, go to Settings > Developer Options and ensure that USB Debugging is turned on.

 Use a high-quality USB cable to connect your phone to your PC or VR headset. Some cables are only capable of charging and don't support data transfer, which is needed for SideQuest.

- Check USB Port: Try different USB ports on your PC or headset to rule out the possibility of a port issue.

- Restart Devices: Sometimes, restarting your phone and the other device (PC or VR headset) can resolve connectivity issues.

- Update SideQuest: Ensure that you're using the latest version of the SideQuest app.

- Security Settings: On Android phones, check your security settings to ensure they're not preventing the connection.

- Try Wireless Mode: If the USB method is problematic, consider setting up a wireless connection via SideQuest. This can be a more stable method once established.

- Consult Documentation: Refer to the SideQuest setup guide for detailed instructions: [SideQuest Setup Guide](https://sdq.st/download).

If you've tried these steps and are still facing issues, it could be helpful to provide more details about the specific problem you're encountering, such as any error messages or the model of your phone and VR headset. This information can be crucial in pinpointing the exact cause of the problem.

 You'll know when a connection is possible once you see a USB debugging RSA fingerprint prompt

 I hope this helps! Godspeed.

name: Not Authorized
message:
Hello there,

Try restarting your headset and switching dev mode off and on.

A defective USB cable could be the culprit. Experiment with other cables you possess or borrow one before purchasing a new one. Try different USB ports and flip the Type-C end 180 degrees.

Re-verifying their developer account (using a credit card instead of a phone number), toggling Debug Mode in the Meta Quest app, and factory resetting have worked for some users.

If possible, use another PC or the SideQuest app from the Android Play Store for testing.

Remember, [Meta Quest Support](https://www.meta.com/help/support/) could also help with Debug issues.

Godspeed!

name: ScrCpy2 Audio routing
message:
Hello!

Regarding your question about ScrCpy2 and its audio routing feature: ScrCpy2, commonly used for streaming, is set up to route audio by default. There isn't a built-in option within the app to disable this feature. However, you can find detailed instructions on how to stop audio rerouting by visiting the ScrCpy2 GitHub page. They have a specific section dedicated to audio management, which should provide the guidance you need.

You can access this information directly through the following link: [ScrCpy2 Audio Management](https://github.com/Genymobile/scrcpy/blob/master/doc/audio.md). This page will give you a comprehensive overview and step-by-step instructions on customising the audio settings to your preference.

If you have any further questions or need more assistance on another issue, feel free to make a new post 

Godspeed!

name: Premature end of stream, needed 1 more bytes
message:
Hi traveller! 

Thanks for reaching out. This problem can arise from several factors. A frequent cause is a USB connection issue. Try using a different USB cable or port if you can, and steer clear of USB3 because of its known ADB compatibility issues, which is the fundamental connection to your headset. The problem might also be tied to a specific app on SideQuest. Let us know if it's only happening with one app. Godspeed, traveller!

name: INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE
message:
Hey there! 

This error - INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE - means your headset storage space is low. Try uninstalling some apps or games. Godspeed, traveller!

name: INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE
message:
Hey there! 

The error you're encountering—INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE—indicates that the app you're attempting to install already exists on your device and the installed version is newer. To fix this, you'll need to uninstall the current app before you try to reinstall it. Please remember to uninstall the app from all accounts on your headset.

If you can't locate the app in 'Unknown Sources', it's suggested to uninstall it from the desktop SideQuest app. Navigate to the 'My Apps' screen on SideQuest, locate the app using its name or package name (e.g., net.kdt.pojavlaunch for QuestCraft), click on the cogwheel icon, and then select 'Uninstall'. 

God speed traveller!

name: Linux Support
message:
Hey!

Support for Linux is somewhat limited due to the vast number of distributions and the occasional need for additional software or configuration.

Typically, you can extract the tarball and run either `./sidequest` or `./sidequestlite`, depending on your version. The app, built on Electron, is open-source—Linux users can compile it from the source available at [SideQuest's GitHub repository](https://github.com/SideQuestVR/SideQuest).

I hope this information proves helpful!

name: Screen copy Mac
message:
Hey there!

SideQuest utilizes a software called scrcpy (Screen Copy) for streaming. While not included in the Mac version of SideQuest for various reasons, it's still possible to use scrcpy on Mac. Check out [guiscrcpy](https://guiscrcpy.srev.in/), a free software that leverages Scrcpy and supports Mac. 

Best of luck traveller!

name: Connecting...
message:
Hey there! 

Thanks for reaching out. This issue arises when something hinders ADB from running. Attempt uninstalling SideQuest, and when prompted to remove app data, select 'yes'. Then, install the latest version from [here](https://sdq.st/download)—scroll down for the Advanced Installer.

If you continue to face issues, your antivirus might be blocking ADB. Check its Vault, Quarantine, or similar sections for an entry named 'ADB.exe' and remove it. Temporarily disabling your antivirus can also help identify if it's causing the issue.

Should the problem persist, consider trying on a different computer or using our Android app on Google Play. 

Godspeed traveller!

name: Downloading...
message:
Hello!

It looks like you encountered an issue where your download got interrupted, possibly due to a temporary disconnection of the USB cable. This can sometimes cause downloads to get stuck or freeze.

To resolve this, I'd recommend first reconnecting your Quest to SideQuest using the USB cable. Once you've re-established the connection, switching to Wi-Fi mode is a good next step. This can help prevent similar issues by reducing reliance on the physical USB connection.

Alternatively, for an even smoother experience, you might want to use the 'Web Installer' using a Chrome browser: https://sdq.st/download. This tool, available on the PC, allows you to install SideQuest directly onto your headset with minimal hassle. If you're using the mobile app, you can find this option by tapping the three dots in the bottom right corner, going to tools, and selecting 'Install SideQuest into your headset' at the top of the menu.

For a more detailed guide on setting this up, you can visit the following link: SideQuest Setup Guide.

I hope this helps! Wishing you the best on your VR adventures. If you have any more questions or issues, don't hesitate to reach out. Godspeed!

name: Parsing issue
message:
Hello there,

If you've updated your Quest, the game might not be compatible with the new API implemented by Meta—this requires the game developer to release an update. Alternatively, if your Quest OS is older and the game has been updated to the new API, you'll need to update your Quest.
